title: 107_s1625
content: The "Children's Health Equity Act of 2001" allows for up to 4 state waivers to use Title XXI allotments to increase Medicaid children's enrollment. The definitions in this section include terms like "child," "child health assistance," "enhanced FMAP," "Federal medical assistance percentage," and "poverty line" as defined in the Social Security Act. The Secretary of Health and Human Services defines terms like "Secretary" and "State child health plan" under the Social Security Act. The Secretary can approve up to 4 waiver applications for states that meet specified requirements related to SCHIP income eligibility. The State child health plan must have the highest income eligibility standard allowed under title XXI of the Social Security Act, not limit applications for children, provide benefits to all eligible children statewide, and not impose any waiting list for children with family income at or below 200 percent of the poverty line. Additionally, the State must implement at least 4 specified policies and procedures. The State child health plan must have the highest income eligibility standard allowed under title XXI of the Social Security Act, not limit applications for children, provide benefits to all eligible children statewide, and not impose any waiting list for children with family income at or below 200 percent of the poverty line. Additionally, the State must implement at least 4 specified policies and procedures related to coverage of children under titles XIX and XXI of the Social Security Act, including using a uniform application form and eliminating asset tests for children. The State must ensure that eligibility for children's medical assistance is not regularly redetermined more than once a year. Initial eligibility determinations and redeterminations must use the same verification policies, including face-to-face interviews. The State must ensure that eligibility for children's medical assistance is redetermined annually using the same verification policies, including face-to-face interviews. Outstationing enrollment staff at designated facilities for processing applications for benefits under titles XIX and XXI of the Act. Payment authorized for States with a waiver approved under section 1905(l)(2)(B) of the Social Security Act. The Secretary will pay the State from its allotment under section 2104 for each fiscal year starting in 2002. The Secretary determines total medical assistance expenditures for children in a state under title XIX of the Social Security Act for fiscal year 1995. This includes base expenditure amount, current expenditure amount, increased expenditures, and bonus amount. The bonus amount for a fiscal year is calculated based on the total amount determined under subparagraph (C) and the difference between the enhanced FMAP and the Federal medical assistance percentage for that State. Children eligible for medical assistance under title XIX of the Social Security Act are included in this calculation. Children who exceed the highest income eligibility level under the State plan but would be considered disabled under the Social Security Act for supplemental security income benefits. Order of title xxi payments in a State with a waiver approved under this section follows a specific sequence for expenditures outlined in the Social Security Act. The order of title xxi payments in a State with a waiver approved under this section follows a specific sequence for expenditures outlined in the Social Security Act, including expenditures for items described in paragraph (1)(D) of such section.
